name: jamers
text: No one is ever ready.

name: zem
text: Probably a kangaroo is the best representation of alacrity

name: catachresis
text: That strip is a damn good one

name: zaratustra
text: well blow me down he wasn't sassing about liking the things

name: philosophe
text: Not to knock you, but I am fairly sure that refers to a puma.

name: zem
text: how could you do this to me

name: philosophe
text: Just saying, the Puma logo is usually in puff embroidery whereas KangaRoos have a logo that is an applique.

name: zem
text: my... my house of cards

name: philosophe
text:
Forget about your house of cards.

And I'll do mine.

name: mountain
text: A comment left by mountain was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by relaxing, zaer, Xaxx)

name: soticoto
text: This conversation line has used up my entire quota of Chubbies for this page.

name: philosophe
text:
It's my favorite song on that album.

I also enjoy 15 step and All I Need. Did you catch the New Year's concert broadcast? I wissed it unfortunately.

name: philosophe
text: *missed. wissed is probably better, though.

name: relaxing
text: There is a link in my profile where you can find their webcast performance of 'Ceremony', which might be the best thing ever.

name: stagnantdisplay
text:
You know what's better than Radiohead playing Ceremony?

Joy Division playing Ceremony. Or New Order. Or even Xiu Xiu.
(get ready for the lames)

name: riazm
text: I dug on the Xiu Xiu version of Ceremony pretty hard.

name: kaithekender
text: If you really want lames then you have to actually come out and say that you do not like Radiohead. I will take the fall here. I do not like Radiohead.

name: xaxx
text: Gotta say, Radiohead is really terrible.  Well, at least the vocals and lyrics are terrible.  The music is pretty standard.

name: philosophe
text:
Also!

I see Nude or Videotape as the worst songs on In Rainbows.

name: killerlimpet
text: They just look bad because they're on the same album as Bodysnatchers

name: goro
text: I totally love/hate that album.

name: killerlimpet
text: On second thought, videotape is pretty sweet, and the album as a whole grows on you nicely with subsequent listens. It certainly has on me, albeit much slower than OK Computer

name: scraggg
text: Everybody has managed to forget about Reckoner, one of Radiohead's best compositions period.

name: mystkmanat
text: I can't listen to either of those songs all the way through.  As someone who turns to OK Computer in times of trouble, it physically hurts me.

name: mystkmanat
text: I think I just accidentally quoted The Beatles in my post about Radiohead.

name: saint
text:
Faust Arp did kick House of Cards ass on the album, but Radiohead...
nothing they have ever done is shitty.

name: karljw
text:
NO ONE HAS MENTIONED JIGSAW FALLING OUT OF PLACE

HOW IS THIS POSSIBLE

name: karljw
text: and by out of i mean into. god that is embarrassing

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
your delicious embarrassment is Roygbiv.

i mean, All I Need.

name: catachresis
text: I love how Beef knows it is a review of his life from those sentences

name: ferdinand
text: those sentences and the fact that it's anthony lane.  the hell else does that guy do in shoes?  every time i see him in a pair of nikes, he's talkin shit about someone's life.

name: flynn
text: Roast Beef dares to hope and is punished.

name: nutmeg
text: operant conditioning, dogg. CAN I GET A HELL YEAH FOR AP PSYCH?!

name: boredom_man
text:
Anyone saying HELL YEAH about high school psychology classes, AP or otherwise, needs to be taken out and shot for the good of their parents, siblings, children, and any unfortunate hypothetical lovers.

Just sayin'

name: nutmeg
text:
your avatar is an illustration of what you describe!

and harsh.

name: boredom_man
text: Was that excessive? It ain't personal about you, bra. All blame on the textbooks and not the students, until you mention projection  <strike>or anger management</strike>  and then I will beat you like a recent suicide beats a sumo wrestler, which granted might not be very physically painful for the sumo wrestler but is probably rather hard to explain to said athlete's friends.

name: nutmeg
text: freudian bullshit  <strike>and a lame movie</strike> .

name: charchar
text:
HELL YEAH FOR AP PSYCH. SKINNER FTW.

My mom's a therapist. I dare you to say anything , and she will have you guilt-trippin' balls.

name: boredom_man
text:
BRING THE GUILT ON, SHIKSA

I will take your mom to Freud school in the bris of pain

name: charchar
text:
And Oedipus rears his ugly head, projecting his rage at his own suffocating mother... I don't know where this is going.

There. You've rendered an insecure adolescent girl speechless and destroyed her fragile self-concept. I hope you are happy, boredom_man.

name: boredom_man
text: The band teacher: in death as in life.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: no, 'cos i learned that in regular psych.

name: tinhand
text:
Surely worse things could happen. I wouldn't mind a review of my life personally.

"oh man oh hilarious" made it for me.

name: fatcat
text: Chubb'd for the Nomi avatar.

name: mercuri0us
text: I like the way Snrub thinks.

name: hellabosque
text:
after i read this the first time, i googled anthony lane and read a bit of his stuff.
it was a good use of my time.

name: ttagxamm
text: Likewise. In fact I ended up checking out from the library his book of collected reviews and essays, Nobody's Perfect . Great stuff.

name: hollis
text: Diatoms are so small though, there really couldn't be very much offal in 'em.

name: juanclaudius
text: Fossilized diatoms all fuse together into a chalky rocklike layer in the earth, in spots. I got a chunk, and though there's no offal, the dust it leaves on your hands and clothes could be the substance referred to.

name: aperson
text: ALT: The cat's life is denigrated by Anthony Lane.

name: crinklebat
text: I love this strip for personal reasons. Specifically my friend has those shoes and I can so picture Beef's skinny legs coming on up out of them. Oh man oh hilarious.

name: shogun
text: Nathan Lane? That's not very scary.  Hold on, I'm getting a call.

name: binlaggin
text:
I would like to say that this is my favourite stip. It is because of the hilarious juxtaposition between "judas priest friday the 13th" and a review of your life by a snarky and pretentious person.

For me a joke is really funny when I can't resist the urge to explain it, and therefore ruin it, for other people.

name: jordstar
text: Panels two-three happened to me verbatim in 1997. Two dollars at Value Village. I wore the hell out of those 'roos. When I read this strip I feel much warm fuzziness.

name: tagrineth
text: oh shiiiiiiiiit

name: soticoto
text: Nothin quite as funny as the irony that Beef is wearing shoes but absolutely nothing else .

name: redmange
text: Why does Lane even gotta do a thing?

name: bixschmix
text: According to Wikipedia , diatomaceous earth is used to make cat litter. That the shoes (and Anthony Lane I suppose) choose this descriptor to make the comparison makes me get way to o analytical.

name: mulisha7
text: I love a little Sturm und Drang in the morning. Goes good with earl grey tea and raspberry biscuits.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Fuck that.
Sturm und Drang in the morning; See the lonely boy in the evening.

name: operamindcrime
text: This might be my single favourite Achewood.  I can't quite work out why.  Part of it has to do with just how distressed Beef is by the fact that Anthony Lane is reviewing his life, part of it has to do with the incongruity of the JUDAS PRIEST FRIDAY panels, but it's mostly inexplicable.

name: binlaggin
text: I have chubbied you, sir, because we agree.  (see above).

name: binlaggin
text: Ah, I see you are of the female persuasion.  Please accept this correction: I have chubbied you, o woman, because we agree.  (see above).

name: lemminadetate
text: I kind of get the feeling that Cornelius is based a bit on Anthony Lane, what with his witted verbose criticisms and whatnot.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i really want a pair of these shoes.

name: joestork
text: Don't stress too hard, Roast Beef, if it's really Anthony Lane it'll probably be chock full of delightful bon mots and you'll get to the end not knowing exactly what the hell he was trying to say about your life anyway.

name: puguglypress
text: "So was it... good?"

name: fineoakstructure
text: This sounds more like Christopher Hitchens.  Except for the "delightful" part.

name: nice-on-water
text: He is just having a good old time with the idea of those shoes.

name: nohassles
text: Everyone's all over Beef's dismay, but I am really into his initial delight. All expecting to be in the news because he found some pirate gold in his thrift store kicks.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: treasure

name: theyang
text: Can't believe they happen to be good fit
